did.unittitle: Yale Collection of American Literature Letter Collection

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Yale Collection of American Literature Letter Collection contains single letters and small groups of letters acquired by the Beinecke Library from various sources and at various times, previously represented in the Beinecke Manuscripts Card Catalog. Letters sometimes include enclosures such as manuscript drafts and clippings. Folders frequently contain additional provenance, descriptive, or other information not reflected in this list.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library. Collection of American Literature

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials acquired by gift or purchase from various sources, as noted in the finding aid and on folders.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Yale Collection of American Literature Letter Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale Collection of American Literature Letter Collection. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection includes materials previously identified by the following call number: ZA Letter File.

Until circa 1980, the library filed and cataloged single and small groups of letters in an artifician collection titled ZA Letter File. In the mid-1990s, the library converted the catalog cards into a finding aid, and began the Yale Collection of American Literature MSS Miscellany, which includes single or small groups of letters and manuscripts acquired after 1980 and arranged by the author's name. Also in the mid-1990s, the library began the practice of cataloging in Orbis any item, regardless of size, that warranted full subject access.

Dates in brackets are supplied by the archivist. The physical form of each item is identified by the following abbreviated notations: Typescript Letter Signed (TLS); Autograph Letter Signed (ALS); Note Signed (NS); Autographed Note Signed (ANS); Typed Manuscript Signed (TMS); Autograph Manuscript Signed (AMS).

In the course of converting the card files to a finding aid for ZA Letter File, non-original ancillary material, including later newspaper and journal clippings (previously uncataloged), as well as photocopies and photostats of manuscript originals not held by the Beinecke Library, were removed at the request of the curator. Folders of material received from the Yale University Press were removed to the Yale University Press collection (ZA Yale University Press). In 2011, the ZA Letter File was renamed Yale Collection of American Literature Letter Collection and assigned a new call number YCAL MSS 446.
All pertinent bibliographical information from the previosuly existing card set in the Manuscripts Catalog has been retained.
In some cases, items were removed from ZA Letter File and repatriated to manuscript collections during processing.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Yale Collection of American Literature Manuscript Miscellany (YCAL MSS MISC) and Yale University Press Records. Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Yale Collection of American Literature Letter Collection contains single letters and small groups of letters acquired by the Beinecke Library from various sources and at various times, previously represented in the Beinecke Manuscripts Card Catalog. Letters sometimes include enclosures such as manuscript drafts and clippings. Folders frequently contain additional provenance, descriptive, or other information not reflected in this list.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files are arranged alphabetically by name main entry, which usually is the author of the piece. In a few cases, however, the material is filed under the name of the person who is the subject or recipient of the letter(s). Cross references from older forms of names used as main entries in the card catalog have been included in this online list, as necessary. Two unidentified items are filed at the beginning of the collection.

did.unittitle: SHEFFIELD, AMELIA MAXCY DAGGETT
Autograph album with contributions in the form of notes or original verses written to her as Amelia M. Daggett.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Includes entries by: John Daggett, her father; William Cullen Bryant; Laura Curtis Bullard; C. P. Miller; J[ohn] Quincy [Adams] Ward (with an original pen-and-ink sketch); John Hay; Kate Field; Richard H. Derby; Isaac H. Bromley; Whitelaw Reid; Bret Harte (with a pen-and-ink sketch probably by him); Thomas W. Knox; Albert Rhodes; Junius Henri Browne; Edmund Clarence Stedman; Josiah G. Holland; Robert Bonner (four lines of manuscript music); Clarence King; Parke Godwin (eight lines "from Mrs. Kemble" in his hand); Frederick A. P. Barnard; Bayard Taylor; Lucia Gilbert Runkle; Rowland R. Hazard (with a water-colored original drawing); N. M. Hutchinson; John S. White; S. Elliott; John R. G. Hassard; Francis Korbay (eighteen bars of manuscript music); Noah Brooks (original verses based on Edgar Allan Poe's "The Bells"); Mary Mapes Dodge; Edward L. Burlingame; A[nna] H. Leonowens; Richard Watson Gilder; and R. H. Stoddard
In English, Greek, and Sanskrit
61 page, including original drawings and ms music
Full calf, oblong
From the Estate of Mrs. George St. John Sheffield, June 1937
